---

## SERVICES

### Forestry Mulching
Mechanical vegetation management for property development, fire mitigation, and land restoration. Designed to efficiently reduce brush and timber while minimizing soil disturbance and erosion.

### Defensible Space / Fire Fuels Reduction
Selective clearing around structures and access routes to reduce wildfire risk. Combines mechanical mulching and hand work where terrain or slope requires alternate methods.

### Access Creation & Site Preparation
New access on vacant land including clearing, subgrade preparation, drainage shaping, and gravel base installation. Built for durability, equipment access, and long-term maintenance.

### Driveway Installation & Repair
New driveway construction and rehabilitation including stripping topsoil where required, installing compacted gravel base, shaping for drainage, and optional fabric or culverts.

### Land Clearing (Selective)
Targeted removal of trees and vegetation to support building sites, access routes, and utility corridors without unnecessary disturbance.

### Timber & Stump Work
Per-tree and per-stump services for oversized timber, hazard trees, and stumps, performed standalone or in combination with larger site work.

---

## PROCESS

1. Evaluate site conditions and access
2. Confirm scope, slope, and constraints
3. Select appropriate methods and equipment
4. Execute work safely and efficiently
5. Leave the site stable and functional

---

## SERVICE AREA

Bitterroot Valley and surrounding Western Montana communities.

---

## PERMITS (REQUIRED)

Permit requirements vary by state, county, and city.  
Property owners are responsible for all permits.

To determine permit requirements, property owners should contact their local county planning department, road department, or city building office for the jurisdiction where the property is located.
